title: Women's T20 World Cup points table: Updated standings ahead of IND v AUS
description: India will play Australia tomorrow (October 13) in the marquee clash of Group A. Here's the updated points standings from both groups ahead of the fixture.
author: Katya Witney
excerpt: India will play Australia on October 13 in the marquee clash of Group A - here are the updated points standings from both groups ahead of the fixture.
text: Oct 12, 2024 2 minute read News India will play Australia tomorrow (October 13) in the marquee clash of Group A. Here's the updated points standings from both groups ahead of the fixture. India's loss in their opening match of the tournament against New Zealand put them on the back foot in terms of semi-final qualification. Their less than convincing chase against Pakistan in their following match also limited their chances of increasing their NRR, which they will likely need to rely on in order to reach the knockouts. However, India did record their biggest ever win in a women's T20 World Cup against Sri Lanka to give their NRR a significant boost. Having played three matches, the same as Australia, New Zealand and Pakistan in Group A, India sit second in the table ahead of the Australia match. They are equal on points with New Zealand, with an NRR of +0.576 compared to the White Ferns' +0.282. However, New Zealand have already played Australia and lost, and only have Pakistan left to play. If New Zealand beat Pakistan and India lose to Australia, India will be eliminated. While India's best chance of semi-final qualification is to beat Australia, they will also have their NRR to think about. They will have to make sure they beat Australia by a big enough margin to stay ahead of New Zealand if they beat Pakistan. If India lose to Australia and New Zealand lose to Pakistan, India will have to lose by a small enough margin to stay ahead of New Zealand. Updated Women's T20 World Cup 2024 points table Group A Team Matches Won Lost Points Net Run Rate Australia 3 3 0 6 +2.786 India 3 2 1 4 +0.576 New Zealand 3 2 1 4 +0.282 Pakistan 3 1 2 2 -0.488 Sri Lanka 4 0 4 0 -2.173 Group B Team Matches Won Lost Points Net Run Rate South Africa 4 3 1 6 +1.382 West Indies 3 2 1 4 +1.527 England 2 2 0 4 +0.653 Bangladesh 3 1 2 2 -0.835 Scotland 3 0 3 0 -2.671 Follow Wisden for all cricket updates, including live scores, match stats, quizzes and more. html:
Oct 12, 2024 2 minute read News

India will play Australia tomorrow (October 13) in the marquee clash of Group A. Here's the updated points standings from both groups ahead of the fixture.

India's loss in their opening match of the tournament against New Zealand put them on the back foot in terms of semi-final qualification. Their less than convincing chase against Pakistan in their following match also limited their chances of increasing their NRR, which they will likely need to rely on in order to reach the knockouts. However, India did record their biggest ever win in a women's T20 World Cup against Sri Lanka to give their NRR a significant boost.

Having played three matches, the same as Australia, New Zealand and Pakistan in Group A, India sit second in the table ahead of the Australia match. They are equal on points with New Zealand, with an NRR of +0.576 compared to the White Ferns' +0.282. However, New Zealand have already played Australia and lost, and only have Pakistan left to play. If New Zealand beat Pakistan and India lose to Australia, India will be eliminated.

While India's best chance of semi-final qualification is to beat Australia, they will also have their NRR to think about. They will have to make sure they beat Australia by a big enough margin to stay ahead of New Zealand if they beat Pakistan. If India lose to Australia and New Zealand lose to Pakistan, India will have to lose by a small enough margin to stay ahead of New Zealand.

Updated Women's T20 World Cup 2024 points table

Group A

Team Matches Won Lost Points Net Run Rate
Australia 3 3 0 6 +2.786
India 3 2 1 4 +0.576
New Zealand 3 2 1 4 +0.282
Pakistan 3 1 2 2 -0.488
Sri Lanka 4 0 4 0 -2.173

Group B

Team Matches Won Lost Points Net Run Rate
South Africa 4 3 1 6 +1.382
West Indies 3 2 1 4 +1.527
England 2 2 0 4 +0.653
Bangladesh 3 1 2 2 -0.835
Scotland 3 0 3 0 -2.671
